result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J.T. Lechner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
cases #15CM430, #16CM328 called at 2:53pm 
Defendant Zachary Jt Lechner appears from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court verifies with Mr. Lechner that he can see and hear the proceedings through the Zoom video-conferencing system.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel. 

On Case #15CM430-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Lechner to:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges concurrent with Case #16CM328.  Mr. Lechner may have electronic monitoring in the discretion of the Sheriff, if the Sheriff believes that the pandemic warrants such electronic monitoring status. 
Days credit for time already served given: 75 days 
_____________
On Case #16CM328-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Lechner to:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges concurrent with Case #15CM430.  Mr. Lechner may have electronic monitoring in the discretion of the Sheriff, if the Sheriff believes that the pandemic warrants such electronic monitoring status. 
Days credit for time already served given: 75 days 

The Court orders entry of civil judgments for the amount of court financial obligations that are still due; the amounts are to be finalized by the clerk.  
recess 3:10pm.

Cases 15CM430,16CM328, 16CM330 called together at 3:07pm [ma]
Defendant Zachary J.T. Lechner in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CM430 and Count #1 of Case 16CM328; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2 of Case 15CM430 and Case 16CM330

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 of Case 15CM430 and Count #1 of Case 16CM328, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription 
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to pay statutory costs 
--As to Case 15CM430: to pay $25 drug testing fee 
--provide DNA sample

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 3:29pm

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] cases #15CM430, #16CM328, #16CM330 called at 2:00pm. 
Defendant Zachary JT Lechner in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
[Before the Court called the case Mr. Lechner informed the clerk that the address in Fort Gibson, Oklahoma (listed in Case #15CM430) is no longer valid-- his permanent address is 1208 E. Main Street, Watertown WI 53094.]

Initial Appearance held in Cases #16CM328, #16CM330:
-----Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
-----Right to counsel given; the Court refers the Defendant to the PD Office
-----Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense

-----In each case the Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
------no possession or consumption of alcohol
-----no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-----to take all prescribed medications as precribed 
-----no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
-----not to operate a motor vehicle unless validly licensed 
-----in Case #16CM328 only: to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

As to Case #15CM430, the Court verifies that Mr. Lechner understands that he has been removed from the First Offender Program, and that Attorney Mazza no longer represents him in that case.
